alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 4:36PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Norfolk and City of Portsmouth. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 PM EDT, the public reported flooded roads throughout the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rain has ended, and the Flash Flood Warning that was in effect is being replaced with a Flood Warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Downtown Portsmouth, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Churchland, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Cradock, Norview, Norfolk NAS, Western Branch, Bowers Hill, South Norfolk, Portlock, Wards Corner and Willoughby Spit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth
